{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2013}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Emiliano Martínez | image = Damian Martinez.jpg | caption = Martínez with Arsenal in 2015 | fullname = Damián Emiliano Martínez{{cite web |title=E. Martínez |url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/damian-martinez/102587/ |website=Soccerway |accessdate=14 February 2019}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1992|9|2|}}{{cite web |title=Emiliano Martínez |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/4245/Emiliano-Mart%C3%ADnez/overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=14 February 2019}} | birth_place = [[Mar Del Plata]], Argentina | height = 1.95 m | position = [[Goalkeeper (association football)|Goalkeeper]] | currentclub = [[Reading F.C.|Reading]]
(on loan from [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]) | clubnumber = 26 | youthyears1 = 2008–2010 | youthclubs1 = [[Club Atlético Independiente|Independiente]] | youthyears2 = 2010–2012 | youthclubs2 = [[Arsenal F.C. Academy|Arsenal]] | years1 = 2012– | clubs1 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | caps1 = 6 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2012 | clubs2 = → [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] (loan) | caps2 = 1 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2013–2014 | clubs3 = → [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] (loan) | caps3 = 11 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2015 | clubs4 = → [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] (loan) | caps4 = 8 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2015–2016 | clubs5 = → [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] (loan) | caps5 = 13 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2017–2018 | clubs6 = → [[Getafe CF|Getafe]] (loan) | caps6 = 3 | goals6 = 0 | years7 = 2019 | clubs7 = → [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] (loan) | caps7 = 6 | goals7 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2009 | nationalteam1 = [[Argentina national under-17 football team|Argentina U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 2 |nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2009–2011 | nationalteam2 = [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina U20]] | nationalcaps2 = 5 |nationalgoals2 = 0 | club-update = 00:23, 24 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Damián Emiliano Martínez''' ({{IPA-es|daˈmjan emiˈljano ˈemi maɾˈtines|am}}, born 2 September 1992 in [[Mar Del Plata]]) is an Argentine professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for English club [[Reading F.C.|Reading]], [[loan (sports)|on loan]] from [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]. ==Club career== [[File:1 Emiliano Martínez 2018.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Martínez in 2018 before an [[International Champions Cup]] game]] He made his début in the [[The Football League|English Football League]] on emergency loan to [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] in their final game of the season against [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] in [[Football League Two|League Two]] on 5 May 2012;{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/reserves-news/martinez-joins-oxford-on-emergency-loan |title=Martinez joins Oxford on emergency loan |publisher=Arsenal FC |date=4 May 2012 |accessdate=7 May 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120507040156/http://www.arsenal.com/news/reserves-news/martinez-joins-oxford-on-emergency-loan|archive-date=7 May 2012|dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all}} Port Vale won 3–0.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17878372 |title=Port Vale 3 Oxford Utd 0 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 May 2012 |accessdate=7 May 2012}}{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/reserves-news/43298/loan-watch- |title=Loan Watch: Wellington scores for Alcoyano |publisher=Arsenal FC |accessdate=7 May 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120510060549/http://www.arsenal.com/news/reserves-news/43298/loan-watch-|archive-date=10 May 2012|dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all}} Martinez has been named on the Arsenal substitute bench for their fixtures away at [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] on 26 August 2012 and against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] on 2 September 2012 as [[Wojciech Szczęsny]] and [[Łukasz Fabiański]] were injured at the time and at Southampton on 1 January 2013. On 26 September 2012, he made his Arsenal début in a 3rd Round [[2012–13 Football League Cup|League Cup]] tie at home to [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]].{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19645217 |title=BBC Sport – Arsenal 6–1 Coventry |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=26 September 2012 |accessdate=16 January 2013}} He then made his second Arsenal appearance in the following round in a 7–5 win away at [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] in which Arsenal were 4–0 down.{{Soccerbase season|62458|2012|access-date=16 January 2013}} On 15 October 2013, Martínez transferred to [[Football League Championship|Championship]] side [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] on an emergency 28-day loan agreement.{{cite web |url=http://www.swfc.co.uk/news/article/arsenal-talent-joins-owls-1114863.aspx? |title=Arsenal talent joins Owls |publisher=Sheffield Wednesday F.C. |date= |accessdate=15 October 2013}} On 14 November 2013 Arsenal announced that the loan agreement had been extended until 1 January 2014.{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/martinez-extends-loan-deal-at-wednesday |title=Martinez extends loan deal with Owls | News Archive | News |publisher=Arsenal.com |date=2013-11-14 |accessdate=2015-03-27}} Martínez made his debut for Wednesday on 23 November 2013 against Yorkshire rivals [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]]. The loan was extended to the end of the season soon after. Martínez was an unused substitute as Arsenal won the [[2014 FA Community Shield|Community Shield]] on 10 August 2014, with a 3–0 win over [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].{{cite news |last1=Sanghera |first1=Mandeep |title=Arsenal 3–0 Man City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28647186 |accessdate=10 August 2014 |work=[[BBC Sport]] |date=10 August 2014}} He made his Arsenal debut in the [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] group stage match against [[R.S.C. Anderlecht]], which ended in a 2–1 win to Arsenal.{{cite web |last=Draper |first=Rob |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2803749/Anderlecht-1-2-Arsenal-PLAYER-RATINGS-Emiliano-Martinez-impresses-European-debut-Gunners-comeback-victory.html |title=Anderlecht 1–2 Arsenal PLAYER RATINGS: Emiliano Martinez impresses on European debut for Gunners in comeback victory | Daily Mail Online |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2015-03-27}} He then made his Premier League debut as a 2nd half substitute, replacing the injured [[Wojciech Szczęsny]] against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] at the [[Emirates Stadium]].{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2896/premier-league/2014/11/22/6395391/wilshere-szczesny-forced-out-of-manchester-united-clash-as |title=Wilshere & Szczesny forced out of Manchester United clash as injury strikes Arsenal |publisher=Goal.com |date=2014-11-22 |accessdate=2015-03-27}} Because of the injuries of [[Wojciech Szczęsny]] and [[David Ospina]], Martínez was made starting keeper against [[Borussia Dortmund]] on 26 November at the Emirates, keeping a clean sheet as Arsenal won 2–0.{{cite web |last=Chowdhury |first=Saj |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29363037 |title=BBC Sport – Arsenal 2–0 Borussia Dortmund |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2015-03-27}} His "faultless" performance in the match led to him being named in that week's UEFA team of the week.{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2188080.html |title=UEFA.com's team of the week – UEFA Champions League – News |publisher=UEFA.com |date=2014-11-27 |accessdate=2015-03-27}} He made his first Premier League start on 29 November against West Brom, which was followed by his second Premier League start against Southampton just four days later. He kept two clean sheets as Arsenal won both matches 1–0.{{cite web |last=Reddy |first=Luke |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30156733 |title=BBC Sport – West Bromwich Albion 0–1 Arsenal |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=2014-11-29 |accessdate=2015-03-27}}{{cite web |last=McNulty |first=Phil |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30204434 |title=BBC Sport – Arsenal 1–0 Southampton |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2015-03-27}} On 20 March 2015, Martínez joined [[Football League Championship|Championship]] club [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] on an emergency loan until the end of the season.{{cite news |title=Emiliano Martinez and Lawrie Wilson join Rotherham on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31985338 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |work=BBC Sport |date=20 March 2015}} He made his debut the following day against [[South Yorkshire]] rivals [[Sheffield Wednesday]], conceding two added-time goals in a 3–2 home defeat.{{cite news |title=Rotherham 2–3 Sheff Wed |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31882514 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |work=BBC Sport |date=21 March 2015}} On 2 August 2015, Martínez was an unused substitute as new signing [[Petr Čech]] played for Arsenal in the [[2015 FA Community Shield]], a 1–0 win over [[Arsenal F.C.–Chelsea F.C. rivalry|rivals]] [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].{{cite news |last1=Cryer |first1=Andy |title=Arsenal 1–0 Chelsea |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33667216 |accessdate=2 August 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 August 2015}} On 11 August, he joined [[Football League Championship|Championship]] side [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] on a season-long loan.{{cite news |title=Martinez Deal Completed |url=http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/martinez-deal-completed-2610385.aspx |accessdate=11 August 2015 |publisher=Wolverhampton Wanderers |date=11 August 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151001084853/http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/martinez-deal-completed-2610385.aspx |archivedate=1 October 2015 |df=dmy-all}} On 5 April 2017, Martinez made his first league start of the 2016/17 season as Arsenal beat West Ham 3-0.{{cite web |url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/uncategorized/3270332/emiliano-martinez-with-3rd-clean-sheet-in-4-games-is-he-a-future-arsenal-no-1/ |title=Emiliano Martinez with 3rd clean sheet in 4 games – is he a future arsenal no 1? |website=The Sun.co.uk}} On 2 August 2017, he was loaned to [[La Liga]] side [[Getafe CF]] on a one-year deal.{{cite web |url=http://www.getafecf.com/Noticia/tabid/137/Article/4597/Emiliano-Martinez-cedido-al-Getafe.aspx |title=Emiliano Martínez cedido al Getafe|trans-title=Emiliano Martínez loaned to Getafe |publisher=Getafe CF |language=es |date=2 August 2017 |accessdate=2 August 2017}} On 23 January 2019, he was loaned to [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] until the end of the season.https://www.arsenal.com/news/emi-martinez-joins-reading-loan He made his debut on 29 January against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton]]. A few days later he won man of the match against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]]. ==International career== He was called up to the [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] senior squad to replace [[Óscar Ustari]] to face [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]] in June 2011.{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/reserves-news/martinez-called-up-to-full-argentina-squad |title=Martinez called up to full Argentina squad | News Archive | News |publisher=Arsenal.com |date=2011-06-02 |accessdate=2015-03-27 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924051846/http://www.arsenal.com/news/reserves-news/martinez-called-up-to-full-argentina-squad |archivedate=24 September 2015 |df=dmy-all}} ==Personal life== Martinez is currently sponsored by [[Puma (brand)|Puma]].{{cite web |url=https://mobile.twitter.com/emimartinezz1/status/983719992616210432 |title=Delighted to have signed a new contract with @pumafootball |website=Twitter.com}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 23 February 2019}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and
